name: The Russell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a charming "old world" small hotel in frankly the best location a tourist to Sydney could wish for. You are moments away from Circular Quay meaning an easy train ride to and from the airport and all the ferries around the harbour. The bridge can be seen from outside the hotel and the Opera House is also moments away.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a bit of a rabbit warren but that is part of its charm. The rooms are mostly well appointed (we stayed in 2 different rooms) and are decorated to tie in well with the style of the hotel.
reviews.title: Elegant and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would also point out that the staff are very warm and friendly and were clearly happy to help in any way they could. We arrived from a very long flight from London at 7am and they were happy to provide us with towels to go and shower even though our rooms were not yet ready.
reviews.title: Cannot beat this location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is not a 5 star hotel so don't expect that. However, it is very comfortable and outstanding value for money.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would certainly recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Hotel, B&B or pub with rooms?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Now that we've got that out of the way, we can talk about the hotel itself. It has a pleasant, but not fancy, rooftop area where you can have your evening tipple before going out. With great views, by the way. And it has a separate sitting room for those chillier evenings. It has a wine/cocktail bar (plus snacks) downstairs that is just bursting with character and the perfect place to meet up with mates. Breakfast is served here in the mornings but don't expect much more than a boiled egg, toasts, cereals, fruit salad and yoghurt. There are croissants on offer too but they could have been opened from a supermarket pack. The hostess keeps turning down the toaster heat to minimum so you end up putting your toast through 3 times to get any colour.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you want the best cup of coffee, pot of tea and choice of to-die-for croissants/pastries, then go around the corner in Argyle St to La Renaissance Patisserie (courtyard at back).
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Russell Hotel reception staff are very helpful and friendly. And the cleaning staff are most polite and accommodating.
reviews.title: Fear not! No ghosts to be found in room number 4!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to the rooms. Even when you take the lift, you will still need to walk up and down stairs, so be prepared. Our room was 4 steps down from its door, and it also had access to a cute internal courtyard. The old timber floors squeak with each step but this just adds to the charm and antiquity of the hotel. Our room was in character with style and very comfortably equipped. The ensuite was small but totally adequate. We feel that the more gracious front rooms may have had some street noise issues, but our internal room didn't.
reviews.title: Just Perfect
Excellent five days stay in Sydney.
reviews.text: All in all, the hotel had great ambiance, charm, quirkiness and comfort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: Just got back from a 5 week trip to Australia with my husband - we arrived at The Russell late on a Friday night and couldn't believe the number of 'boy racers' driving up and down revving their engines and with blasting stereos - it was like Southend sea front!! Unfortunately it was just the same on the Saturday evening but was fine on the Sunday so we guessed it must be a weekend thing! The reason for mentioning this is that as the The Russell doesn't have air conditioning you need to leave your windows open which meant it was pretty noisy! We were okay as we were out and about and don't go to bed until late but if you like being in bed quite early or need peace & quiet to drop off then I would bear this in mind and we were surprised that it hadn't been mentioned before!
reviews.title: Right on top of Harbour Bridge & Opera House
Quaint and historic
reviews.text: Regarding the hotel itself - we booked a double room with shared bathroom for 3 nights. The points made previously about there being a lot of stairs are true - if you're staying at the top of the hotel it does give you a bit of a work out going up and down them on a hot day but if you're fit and healthy it shouldn't be too much of a problem! The room was clean but rather tired looking - we found the main problem was lack of space. There were 2 shared bathrooms near us; one very large with 2 sinks and one smaller which were absolutely fine. Breakfast was good and we found the staff to be friendly. We managed to get a little look into the larger en suite rooms and these obviously look much nicer but I'm not sure if it would be worth paying the extra for these, personally if I was going to pay a lot more for a hotel then I would stay elsewhere. The hotel is in a great location (which is what you pay for) for the Opera House and Harbour Bridge but you still need to get train/bus/cab to the other sights that are away from The Rocks area anyway so we came to the conclusion that it's not the be all and end all to stay in this area.

reviews.title: Terrible Hotel but great location...
reviews.text: Good hotel to get a feel of what Sydney was like years ago. We stayed here back in late 2002 and I agree with many comments on the rooms themselves being a little drab and small (and hot) but the breakfast/dining room was great; wooden pannelled walls - we could have spent all morning in there drinking coffee and listening to the classical music; very relaxing in the mornings before a hectic day down-town. Great location.

reviews.title: It's the real deal
reviews.text: We stayed at the Russell for 7 nights and by the end of it were very glad to leave..

reviews.title: too hot for comfort
reviews.text: Whilst the location is great - very close to the opera house, harbour bridge etc. the staff are unfriendly (in fact, I found them rude), the rooms are small and very dark, the bathrooms minute and there is no air conditioning, add to that outside noise and lack of security (someone was burgled when we stayed there).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Russell upon our arrival in Sydney. The location is great. We really enjoyed the roof top deck. Our room was adequate but due to the lit office across the street, it seemed like it never got dark. There was no AC, so we had to leave the window open and the light in.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We Stayed at The Russell Hotel in Sept and Oct 2012. We loved the location. The staff were excellent and so helpfull. The Rooms as long as you go for a recently upgraded one are good...The ones that have not had a makeover are not so good. A couple of the rooms were a wee bit noisy but the location made up for this problem.The rooms on the road side have the music beneath in the wine bar, on Fri and Sat. The room at the back of the Hotel had a bit of air cond noise to...But I slept well any way...
reviews.title: Perfect Central Hotel for Circular Quay and Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my time staying here tho, and would and would go back and do it again any time....
reviews.title: Central to what we wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here because we were doing a ghost tour in the Rocks.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for a Few Days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking was convenient as it was just next door and only cost $25 for the night.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannont begin to describe how conveniently located this hotel is. Every tour we went on, every fantastic restaraunt, every train, every bus, and every ferry all pass through Circular Quay, which is right accross the park from the Russell. It is amazing how being so close to a major transportation hub it can be so quiet, classy and clean. The street it is on holds small upscale restaraunts, friendly pubs, wine bars, historic landmarks, souvenier shops, and the Museum of Modern Art. It seemed like every time we needed to run to the room for a change of clothes, a forgotten camera, or just a quick sit down between sights, it was right there on hand.
reviews.title: Logistic Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I overdo it, let me throw some cons in.
reviews.title: convenient, clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Older building-floors creak.
reviews.title: Best location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Water takes a long time to heat up.
reviews.title: Good Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Small beds
reviews.title: Well located!
Almost Bad
reviews.text: Excellent location, nice folk, lousy product. This hotel was the most unpleasant, uncomfortable hotel stay in years. Somebody needs to take over this hotel and turn it into an upscale boutique. Try the Holiday Inn instead, really!

reviews.title: Very, very small
reviews.text: The rooms are incredibly small. We only had room to put one small suitcase on the floor and still walk around the best. The furniture is vintage - interesting, but not functional (drawers don't open, holes in bottoms of drawers). Bathrooms are also incredibly small with no place to set anything. Really wouldn't advise sharing a bathroom here. The shared bathroom were 2 foot by 2 foot. No exaggeration.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2004
reviews.text: Staff was friendly, but never actually helpful. (Didn't have ice, didn't know good restaurants in the area.) The complimentary breakfast was unusually good.
reviews.title: A terrible experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spent two nights with my wife and two daughters, ages 7 and 12. The Russell is a wonderful heritage hotel in a perfect location in the Rocks. Walk out the door onto George street. Obviously, an older building, but clean and amenities all top notch. Breakfast pleasant and
reviews.title: Weekend stay in the rocks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: generous in the Wine Bar downstairs. Special thanks to Idan (?) who made me a double espresso and the girls hot chocolate as we were running late. All staff willing to assist with trip details and needs. One caution is the band noise from the Fortune of War bar a few doors down. Probably worst on weekends, and something the Russell has no control over, but might be an issue for some patrons...We would stay again in any case....
reviews.title: Charm, character and location
Great location, but all else is ho-hum
reviews.text: We chose this for the convenient location. We knew there would be lots of steps, although there is a lift, but you can't avoid steps even with that. It is an old rabbit-warren, comfortably done up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We paid for a Queen size bed and ensuite and being on the inner part of the hotel, it was lovely and quiet. If you were on the street side it might be a bit noisy. Continental breakfast was included and my husband thought it the best choice he'd had. We could walk everywhere we wanted to from there.
reviews.title: perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't beat the location of the Russell -- in the Rocks and right across the street from Circular Quay.
reviews.title: awful
Everything at your doorstep
reviews.text: Great location. Open the door and everthing is at your doorstep. A great place to go exploring Sydney from. Love the breakfast and staff too.

reviews.title: Great location, but....
reviews.text: I found this hotel through Hotels.com, and liked the price, location, and quaint "feel" to it. I read the reviews on Tripadvisor.com, and was concerned with the number of reviews which loved it, and the ones that hated it - polar views! We stayed in the hotel for five nights, in a "superior" room, which means we had our own bathroom and didn't have to share with one down the hall as some bedrooms must do. We also had a kitchen, which we didn't use. Here are the pros and cons, from our perspective.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: Great location! Probably one of the best. It's about 200 yards from Circular Quay, where all the ferries and water taxis depart, near the Sydney Opera House, the Sydney Bridge, and is in the middle of the Rocks, which is an older section of Sydney which has been preserved and is interesting in so many ways.
reviews.title: Great Location - Not for snobs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: Cost is reasonable, particularly if you compare it to other hotels which are roughly in the same vicinity (Hilton, Four Seasons, Shangri-la, etc.).
reviews.title: For Backpackers!

description: The Russell Hotel with just 30 delightfully different rooms is perfectly located for the Sydney visitor seeking a convenient and characterful base from which to explore this exciting city.Sydney is literally on your doorstep at the Russell with Circular Quay, Sydney Harbour and the Museum of Contemporary Art just across the road.The Russell Hotel is a gorgeous bed and breakfast hotel known for its superb location and charm.No two guest rooms are identical at The Russell , yet all have antique furniture and soft furnishings appropriate to the hotel's historic status.The Russell offers a variety of ensuite rooms and very affordable rooms with shared bathroom. The largest rooms overlook George Street whilst guests in search of tranquillity might prefer one of the courtyard rooms or one above Nurses Walk.
